website_summaries.verdict: The Newton Gravity V is a running shoe for long distance runs, daily training, and uptempo runs. Made lightweight and with enhanced cushioning, flexibility and comfort, this shoe will not disappoint when used on the roads. Despite being expensive, many users still recommend the shoe for road running.
pros: Most runners liked the light weight and comfortable construction of the Newton Gravity V
Many were impressed by the updated features of the Newton Gravity including the 4-way stretch mesh metatarsal panels and new reinforced eyelets
The 5th version of the Newton Gravity offers pre-molded heel counter for enhanced fit and improved form
The improved bottom of this shoe, which provides maximum cushioning and improved flexibility, gained positive feedbacks from testers
cons: The Gravity V is an expensive shoe

customer_reviews.title: Size up 1/2 if transitioning from Brooks/Nike
customer_reviews.text: If you're transitioning to these, trust the size recommendations. For me, I run my Brooks/Nike a little bug, so I thought I'd be fine with the same size in Newton s, way too tight. Exchanged for a half a size larger and niw I love the shoes! They are relatively light and while it takes some getting used to, the lugs really make a difference in keeping my running gate honest. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: I have had other Newton products as well and have always been pleased. I am a hard runner and sometimes toward ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these shoes for the 2nd time now. I have had other Newton products as well and have always been pleased. I am a hard runner and sometimes toward the end of the shoe life the lugs on the front will come off. I have run many marathons in this shoe and I am over all pleased with the product. I can tell you that you will not find a better price than on Amazon though.
customer_reviews.author: Cobra

customer_reviews.title: Good support yet light and comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: Recvd my gravity V 2 weeks ago. Already ran about 50 miles on it. Very comfortable fit around my broad insole and rather high arch. Nice cushioned sole. Plan to wear it for a marathon in 3 weeks. This is my 5th Newton and I like it so far. 1st. Distance 2nd Distance 3 3rd Distance Elite 4th Motion 3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Newton Gravity V Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best running shoes I've ever worn. Cushioned enough for long run days but fast enough for tempo runs. Keeps me running with the correct form and helps me stay injury free. Also, longest lasting shoes I've worn. These are serious shoes for serious runners.
customer_reviews.author: Pete in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: 3rd pair of Newton Gravity shoes
customer_reviews.text: My third pair of Netwon Gravity shoes. Each has been a little different, but I like them either way.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sobczyk

customer_reviews.title: This is a great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great running shoe! I previously purchased the same shoe from a Newton retailer and the price here was great.
customer_reviews.author: Petros

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. It's subjective, but for me, perfect match!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Spray-Tan

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I have suffered with painful feet for years. My Norton runners took the pain away in no time. I love these runners have two pairs now and planing for a third pair. Best ever.
customer_reviews.author: John Michael Collens

customer_reviews.title: ... cycled through half dozen running shoes and none were perfect for me until I found Newton
customer_reviews.text: I have cycled through half dozen running shoes and none were perfect for me until I found Newton. First pair were Gravity IV's. Put on 502 miles and they were great. On the second pair now and after the first run they felt like, well perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ed zulyevic

customer_reviews.title: So far so good - this is my 2nd pair of gravity 5's ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good - this is my 2nd pair of gravity 5's (1st pair was a learning curve fer sure - great shoes after my calves quit burning - able to squeeze over 500 miles out of them) - very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Zabs

customer_reviews.title: Size not consistent with styles
customer_reviews.text: I aways wear size 9 from this company (I wear a size 8 in regular shoes) as I have purchased several pairs from Newton over the years. The style ran a full size smaller than normal so I am taken aback that I would need to go up to a size 9.5 or 10.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Heiden Jones

customer_reviews.title: Happy triathlete!
customer_reviews.text: This si my 5th pair of Newtons, love them! One Ironman and 10 70.3 Ironman running with them.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: Toe Box Too Snug
customer_reviews.text: I've only run in Newtons for the past six years, and these are my least favorite update. The toe box is really cramping my big toe and though I want to love them, I'm looking at other brands. I still run in my III's more often.
customer_reviews.author: Gervase J. Pfeffer

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe for middle to long distances. Pulled them out of box, put them on, and ran 8 miles comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Victor P. Bindi

customer_reviews.title: Newton Gravity
customer_reviews.text: Fit just right do not tie too tight though, a lot of lace used. Do not feel narrow though but have just worn them for walking, not running yet. Have to see if they will be too loose on a jog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes from Newton
customer_reviews.text: Hoka shoes used to be my favorite for the long runs or tempo/intervals. Even though they are great shoes , I always felt somethings is missing during my runs . When I got my Newton shoes and went for my first run I realized what that "missed feeling" was ; THE PURE JOY OF RUNNING . Gravity V is an amazing shoe; light , fast and comfortable . It makes running so fun and liberating . I buy size 12 for my running shoes and Newton 12 fits perfectly fine. I will certainly buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: levrier

customer_reviews.title: Great price. We will continue to purchase these running ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price. We will continue to purchase these running shoes through Amazon in the price right.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn

customer_reviews.title: They are no good. I want to return
customer_reviews.text: When i've used these shoes while running the soles kept on sliding back and so i had to stop every once and awhile to fix the sole. They are no good. I want to return them
customer_reviews.author: Thamara

customer_reviews.title: and this is a good update. The five-lug forefoot is much more stable ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a running shoe, not a walk around shoe. I've been waring Gravities for several years, and this is a good update. The five-lug forefoot is much more stable on turns than the old four-lug design of a couple of versions ago. These shoes last much longer than a standard pair of running shoes because the cushioning is not based on compression of a foam. That said, this is not the best shoe for runners just getting into a mid foot/forefoot strike unless you take that transition very slowly. Newton has other "transition" models you should look at. But for those already on board with the Newton philosophy, this is a good update.
customer_reviews.author: William Jenks

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoe I have used. And buy 0.5 size up.
customer_reviews.author: mountainlab

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Firmer ride than my Gravity III's but good all around fit.
customer_reviews.author: jim hildreth

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I asked for size 12,5... but recieved nr. 12. Too small for me. Shame on you.
customer_reviews.author: GFiedler

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes I've ever had. Many thanks to Danny and Jennifer Abshire. You're the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty stiff right out of the box and need a little while to break in. Similar ride to the gravity IV but with an improved tongue. They are fast shoes for longer distances.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great with the product, but the shipping took forever.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Lee Rollings

product_meta.title: Newton Running Men's Gravity V Running Shoe Training (Green/Blue), 7 UK 41 EU
product_meta.description: The gravity v neutral trainer is built for runners who want a daily training shoe that also functions brilliantly as a faster tempo pace run or a race shoe. This M000116 is the pinnacle of performance and comfort. It will help anyone start their run a step ahead. Runners get better comfort and breathability from the new seamless engineered mesh upper and newly modified, 4-way stretch mesh metatarsal panel. The gravity v combines the highly responsive pop1 platform with a innovative new bottom for enhanced flexibility and full foot cushioning.
feature_bullets: Engineered mesh - Is seamless and provides lightweight breathability and structure in key areas.
4-way Stretch mesh Metatarsal Panel - Offers a more individualized fit.
Overlays - Are anatomically placed to provide a secure fit.
Stabilization tongue - Features a radial band to provide a comfortable precision fit.
Heel Lace Lock - Provides a snug heel lockdown.
